data.title: atom 1.0.3 inserts superfluous characters
data.body:
I use a German keyboard and the package [keyboard-localization](https://atom.io/packages/keyboard-localization).
Today I updated atom to 1.0.3. Since then it inserts superfluous characters:

| I type | I get |
| --- | --- |
| " | "@" |
| ' | '?' |
| . | .. |
| , | ,, |
| - | -- |
| ( | (*) |
| # | #/ |
| + | += |
| * | *+ |
| ) | )() |
| ? | ?{} |
| ß | ß[] |

Most other non-alphanum characters are doubled. 

If I disable keyboard-localization I cannot type several characters like "\" in atom at all. Either way atom is unusable.

data.title: "Search in Directory" should be in a fixed order in the menu
data.body:
When clicking on the project "Search in Directory" will be on the bottom above the last one.
![screen shot 2015-07-29 at 12 06 31](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1763722/8953879/5899c3ca-35ea-11e5-9855-418afc92a716.png)

When clicking on any folder inside the project "Search in Directory" will be the first one in order.
![screen shot 2015-07-29 at 12 06 45](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1763722/8953886/5c72ce88-35ea-11e5-9de2-8e3ce436ce80.png)

This confuse me a lot. I do search a lot and I got confused when I want to search some time it is above and other times is down. I think it would be better to be in a fixed place.

data.title: Saving html files while running CodeKit results in unexpected behavior (since 1.0.3)
data.body:
Running Atom 1.0.3 on OS X 10.10.4 with CodeKit 2.3.10 results in the folder /Applications/Safari.app/Contents/Resources being opened multiple times when saving an HTML file from a project that is active in CodeKit. I am not sure whether the issue is caused by CodeKit or Atom, but I have only encountered it since the update on Atom 1.0.3 which is why I come here first.

I think CodeKit runs BrowserSync in the background. However I was not able to recreate the issue with a Grunt and BrowserSync setup. The error only occurs on html files that are in an active CodeKit project.

![animation-small](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7340779/8952593/807d477a-35d8-11e5-9139-55e70a6d653a.gif)

Do you need any further information?

data.title: Inserting <text-editor-view> tag doesn't observed by Workspace::observeTextEditors
data.body:
Seems like <text-editor-view> tag should be registered as pane item.

EDIT: Nevermind, `Workspace::observeTextEditors` is not supposed to observe it

data.title: Add support for activating and deactivating package-specific keymaps
data.body:
Adds support for activating and deactivating the keymaps for individual packages. Currently, there's no good way to quickly disable conflicting keymaps. Adding `unset!` entries for every binding in your own keymap is tedious and error-prone. This adds `Package` support for activating and deactivating keymaps, so you can easily choose which keymaps from which packages are important to you.

See https://github.com/atom/settings-view/pull/610 for UI support.

Related: https://github.com/atom/atom-keymap/issues/82

data.title: Not Issue, It's about 'marker-clusterer'.
data.body:
Your work is great. And I have to say Thank you.
By the way, I can't find detail information about the marker-clusterer tag.

http://bundlr.com/clips/53f43e6975a6d20b2e00005c

I read your post, but I can't find how to use marker-cluster tag. what is 'markersData'?? How can I use it with my ng-repeat markers??

And say again, Thank for your work!

data.title: opening file cause 'unhandled promise rejection' after adding same folder to project again.
data.body:
When I remove folder from atom.project and add same folder again, after that following all open action  cause `Unhandled promise` error.

Here is console log.
`Unhandled promise rejection Promise with error: TypeError: Cannnot read property 'on' of null`

To reproduce, execute following code.
I also can reproduce same issue by hand (open file in project, right click on tree-view, remove folder/add folder then split).
Opening project contained file at first is required to reproduce.

``` coffeescript
projFolderIssue = ->
    folder = '/Users/t9md/github/atom'
    atom.workspace.open(folder + '/README.md')
    atom.project.removePath folder
    atom.project.addPath folder
    atom.workspace.open(folder + '/README.md')

projFolderIssue()
```

I noticed this behavior my package 'project-folder' which manipulate adding/remove project frequently.

data.title: Fix process leak
data.body:
The process for each project search would stick around:

![screen shot 2015-07-28 at 2 11 12 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/69169/8947369/07e0ad04-354f-11e5-9529-e3db0eadf779.png)

Closes https://github.com/atom/find-and-replace/issues/459

data.title: Update language-go and yaml
data.body:
PRing because two languages changed.

language-go@0.32.0 improves the auto-indent patterns and also adds specs for it :green_heart:!
language-yaml@0.23.0 adds support for `.sls` files and properly handles pound (`#`) symbols in multiline blocks.

Will merge when green.

data.title: Docs refer to primitive wrapper objects like `Boolean` but use primitives
data.body: The docs refer to `Boolean` return types and parameters and link to the MDN docs on the [Boolean object wrapper](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Boolean). Every case actually appears to deal with primitive boolean types though, not the object-wrapped Boolean version. The docs should likely refer to "boolean" (lowercase) and link to the [JavaScript primitive](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Glossary/Primitive) doc on MDN.

data.title: Don’t autoscroll to selection when double- or triple-click dragging
data.body:
Instead just autoscroll to the cursor, which is what we do when single-click dragging.

Fixes #6675

data.title: Use `Returns` keyword in global `atom` object docs
data.body:
Use the `Returns` keyword in function docs so they are put
in panels like other return values in docs.

data.title: Use `Returns` keyword in `ThemeManager` public docs
data.body:
Use the `Returns` keyword in `get*Theme` function docs so they are put
in panels like other return values in docs.

data.title: Use `Returns` keyword to highlight vals in docs
data.body:
Use the `Returns` keyword in `PackageManager::getAvailablePackage*`
docs so the return values are called out in panels like with other
documentation.

data.title: Bind ctrl-up/down to just move up or down by default
data.body:
Fixes #6949

This prevents insertion of weird characters when ctrl-up/down are pressed.

data.title: Unable to create unix-compatible shell script
data.body:
I am trying to create this shell script for Circle-ci integration:

``` bash
#!/bin/bash

# Fix the CircleCI path
function getAndroidSDK(){
  export PATH="$ANDROID_HOME/platform-tools:$ANDROID_HOME/tools:$PATH"

  DEPS="$ANDROID_HOME/installed-dependencies"

  if [ ! -e $DEPS ]; then
    cp -r /usr/local/android-sdk-linux $ANDROID_HOME &&
    echo y | android update sdk -u -a -t android-22 &&
    echo y | android update sdk -u -a -t platform-tools &&
    echo y | android update sdk -u -a -t build-tools-22.0.1 &&
    echo y | android update sdk -u -a -t extra-android-m2repository &&
    echo y | android update sdk -u -a -t extra-google-m2repository &&
    echo y | android update sdk -u -a -t sys-img-x86-android-22 &&
    echo y | android update sdk -u -a -t sys-img-armeabi-v7a-addon-google_apis-google-22 &&
    echo y | android update sdk -u -a -t addon-google_apis-google-22 &&
    echo no | android create avd -n testAVD -f -t android-22 --abi default/x86 && touch $DEPS
  fi
}

# Wait for emulator to start
function waitAVD() {
    local bootanim=""
    export PATH=$(dirname $(dirname $(which android)))/platform-tools:$PATH
    until [[ "$bootanim" =~ "stopped" ]]; do
      sleep 5
      bootanim=$(adb -e shell getprop init.svc.bootanim 2>&1)
      echo "emulator status=$bootanim"
    done
}
```

However, Circle-ci keeps complaining of the following

> scripts/environmentSetup.sh: line 2: $'\r': command not found
> scripts/environmentSetup.sh: line 4: syntax error near unexpected token `$'{\r''
> (source scripts/environmentSetup.sh && getAndroidSDK) returned exit code 1
> ' Action failed: (source scripts/environmentSetup.sh && getAndroidSDK)
> Why isn't your editor capable of creating a normal shell script????

Thanks,
Igor

data.title: Make it easier to find crash reports
data.body:
Atom crashed a lot for me. Normally I would post the crashes up as issues, but there were no logs, or error messages, just a generic "I've crashed" and options to close, ignore, or restart. This leaves me at a bit of a loss as to how to contribute the issue to the community, rather than just ditch atom.

I understand I can potentially get at the error messages by using the internal debugging tools, but that seems a bit obfuscated. Can't it show more information about crashes when they occur? I realise that this is a more of a hacker-oriented tool, but you're reaching wider audiences with the adverts, etc, I personally don't want to run it in dev mode 24/7 just to get info on the crashes :)

(unless there's another way of getting info on past crashes?)

data.title: "Move line down" keyboard shortcut triggers alert sound on OSX
data.body:
Every time I want to move a line down with a key shortcut, the system alert sound is played.
OSX 10.10, and latest Atom.

Key binding resolver shows me that the shortcut is there, also present in the config file:

```
"ctrl-cmd-down": "editor:move-line-down"
```

data.title: Cannot pipe to `atom` command
data.body:
Piping directly to a text editor is incredibly useful. It lets you view massive amounts of somewhat structured temporary data, like disassembly, from a convenient syntactically highlighted GUI. But it doesn't work with atom:

``` bash
echo "foo" | atom
otool -vVjhlt /usr/lib/libSystem.B.dylib | atom
dd bs=$[128*3] count=1 if=/dev/urandom | perl -MMIME::Base64 -E 'while(read STDIN, $x, 3){print encode_base64 $x,""}' | atom
```

(here atom -> `/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/atom.sh`)

data.title: Handle `did-insert-text` and `will-insert-text` events in `Selection`
data.body:
Text insertion is routed through `Selection` and we think it may be beneficial for the code to start emitting text related events (such as `did-insert-text` and `will-insert-text`) right there instead of `TextEditor`.

Refs: #8105

data.title: Create new stacking context for tiles
data.body:
Refs: #8098

To create a new stacking context we need to isolate the container div (https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/Guide/CSS/Understanding_z_index/The_stacking_context).

This fixes a visual glitch on the wrap-guide whenever there are more than 5 tiles (i.e. the wrap guide gets hidden). I am sorry for not catching this early, but apparently I overlooked it while testing #8098.

/cc: @nathansobo

data.title: Add a toggle to disable re-opening previous files at startup
data.body:
While I appreciate many people enjoy the ability to quickly resume work by having Atom re-open the files that were open when Atom last exited, this functionality can also hamper work. With my day-to-day usage of Atom I find the delay in re-opening files to be frustrating, and when attempting to create a new file I find myself often accidentally editing an existing file.

I would like to see a setting added to Atom to toggle between re-opening previous files and opening with only a new file.

data.title: Only build pushes to master on Travis
data.body:
This PR adds some Travis config to only trigger builds for pushes to `master`, instead of building pushes for every branch in the repo. This should help keep our jobs queue from being flooded - it should cut down our number of build jobs from 6 to 3. However, this does preserve triggering builds for PRs.

I think we should probably add this config to every repo in the Atom org.

/cc @as-cii @atom/feedback

data.title: Clarify path separators, partially reverting #8107
data.body: Thanks @izuzak for pointing out that the git shell can take forward slashes, and the original instructions do assume usage of that, as opposed to cmd or Powershell.

data.title: atom always adds characters when I save a file
data.body:
Hello team, 

I have this very weird issue, whenever I open a file with atom everything is fine, I can make modifications until I save the file, and try to commit in git.

Git shows every line in the file as changed, when there is no visible change. I think atom is appending some hidden characters like eol or something.

auto.crlf is set to false in my global config so I don't see when atom may try to convert/add more characters to each line.

Sublime Text, TextWranger, TextEdit all work fine without any issues.

Please advise.

data.title: Correct path separator in Windows Build instructions
data.body: Just a little oversight.

data.title: Text editing performance issue with many markers (persistent: false, maintainHistory: false)
data.body:
I'm creating a plugin that creates quite a few markers with

``` JavaScript
persistent: false,
maintainHistory: false
```

and I'm hitting editing performance issues when I create many markers.

For example, in a source file with 5000 lines and ~2300 markers, adding a single character results in:
![screen shot 2015-07-28 at 7 44 57 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/979966/8928463/01de2f2c-3562-11e5-871c-dde8486918e2.png)

Same operation in a source file 10000 lines and ~4500 markers:

![screen shot 2015-07-28 at 7 41 36 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/979966/8928497/2a86ae68-3562-11e5-96ac-18e4def9cca2.png)

Search markers suffer the same issue, so can it be reproduced by opening a relatively large source file, searching for a single character, such as `a` and trying to type while search markers are rendered. Any code linters suffer the same issue on medium-large files as well.
